data.title: Opportunities at ABT
data.text:
Strategic Marketing Internship

Marketing

General Description: This position is a flexible and creative role, assisting the entire Marketing department with a primary focus on Audience Development, Research, and Data Analysis. Projects and tasks include:

Research performing arts landscape, evaluating pricing and marketing best practices in ballet and other arts industries;

Draft copy and content for web, email, and social media;

Develop reports on ticket sales data and social media analytics;

Research brand partnership opportunities;

Copyedit and review drafts of marketing documents;

Organize marketing archival documents;

Maintain and grow audience development databases;

Attend weekly meetings with Marketing mentors and team to discuss ongoing projects, ask questions, and learn more about ABT;

Help with day-to-day tasks and other Marketing duties as assigned

Position Qualifications:

Must have excellent writing and communication skills. Must be attentive to detail, have ability to meet strict deadlines, and be a self-starter. This position is available to students in at least their Junior-level year of Undergraduate Studies, post-graduation, and Graduate-level students. Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Knowledge of dance and performing arts preferred. Hybrid work environment. Weekly In-person availability required.

Primary Reporting Responsibility:Associate Director, Sales Strategy & Customer Relationship Management

Secondary Reporting Responsibility: Manager, Creative Services and Design

Internship Program Application Form

Social Media Marketing Internship

Marketing Internship

General Description: This position is a digital and social media role, assisting the Digital Marketing Coordinator with a primary focus on content creation, media production. Projects and tasks include:

Drafting social media content and language

Contributing ideas to the social media content calendar

Develop reports on social media analytics

Copyedit and review posts/language

Curate social media ideas for various ongoing campaigns

Attend weekly meetings with the full Marketing team to discuss ongoing projects, ask questions, and learn more about ABT

Assist with any ongoing video productions

Upload content and curate appropriate thumbnails

Participate and aid in production and editing of short and long-form content

Position Qualifications:

Looking for a creative individual to contribute fresh and unique perspectives. Must have excellent writing and communication skills. Must be attentive to detail, have ability to meet strict deadlines, and be a self-starter. This position is available to students in at least their Junior-level year of Undergraduate Studies, post-graduation, and Graduate-level students. Proficiency in all social media platforms, plus the back-ends, Meta Business Suite, Google Analytics, and Adobe Suite preferred. Hybrid work environment. In-person availability required on a weekly basis.

Primary Reporting Responsibility: Coordinator, Digital Marketing

Internship Program Application Form

Creative Services & Design Internship

Marketing Internship

General Description: This position focuses on graphic design and video and photo editing, contributing to the development of visual materials that showcase the beauty and artistry of ballet.

Assist in the creation of visually compelling designs for print and digital materials, including brochures, posters, social media graphics, advertisements, and promotional materials.

Support ABT’s visual identity and brand guidelines across the organization, ensuring consistency in creative materials that align with ABT’s artistic vision and marketing objectives.

Assist in photo and video shoots capturing high-quality images and footage to promote one of ABT’s upcoming New York City seasons.

Assist in editing and retouching photos to meet professional standards.

Liaise across internal ABT departments for coordination of creative assets requests.

Communicate effectively with external vendors, printers, and partners to ensure the timely production and delivery of materials.

Organize and catalogue ABT’s photo and video archive.

Position Qualifications:

Must have excellent communication and collaboration skills. Must be attentive to detail, have ability to meet strict deadlines, and be a self-starter with a strong eye for design, typography, and composition.This position is available to those pursuing or having recently completed a degree in graphic design, visual arts, digital media, or a related field OR have experience in design and creative services. Preferred proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite, including Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, and Lightroom and other graphic design applications, such as Canva . Preferred proficiency in social media channels including Instagram, TikTok, Facebook, etc. Knowledge of dance and performing arts preferred. Hybrid work environment. Weekly In-person availability required.

Primary Reporting Responsibility: Manager of Creative Services and Design

Internship Program Application Form

Engagement Internship

Education & Training

General Description: This position is responsible for assisting the entire Department of Education and Training.

Assist the Engagement Manager in the organization and execution of ABT’s engagement programs

Assist in the preparation of ABTKids and Pre-Performance Workshops

Manage dance shoe inventory and sales for students

Assist with the maintenance and update of community partnership contacts and school database

Organize schedules and general communication between patrons

Assist in archival of department audio and video

Oversee and maintain department filing

Help with day-to-day tasks such as copying and assembling materials

Other duties as assigned

Position Qualifications:

Must have excellent interpersonal skills and work well with children. Must be attentive to detail, have ability to meet strict deadlines, and be a self-starter. A strong dance background is recommended, as well as an interest in the administrative aspects of Family Programming.

Computer literacy is a must, including proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel. Knowledge of dance and performing arts is a requirement.

Must be able to commit to a schedule of 2-3 days a week. Hybrid work environment. In-person availability required.

Primary Reporting Responsibility: Engagement Manager

Internship Program Application Form

National Training Curriculum Internship

Education and Training

This position is primarily responsible for assisting the National Training Curriculum Assistant in organizing ABT’s NTC Raising the Barre Workshop, Teacher Training information, and assisting with ABT Student Examinations. Weekend hours are required on October 26-27, for the Raising the Barre Workshop.

Help organize details related to upcoming teacher trainings and examinations

Attend and assist in the teacher training sessions

Help manage NTC materials invoicing, payments and shipping

Research and update mailing lists for marketing

Oversee and maintain database and website updates

Help with day-to-day tasks such as copying and assembling materials

Print ABT Certificates for teachers and students

Other duties as assigned

Position Qualifications:

Must have excellent interpersonal and organizational skills, as well as attention to detail, the ability to meet strict deadlines, and be a self-starter. The ideal candidate has a strong interest in learning the administrative aspects of running a training program.

Must be at least a sophomore in college. Computer literacy is expected, including proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel. Knowledge of dance and performing arts is a requirement.

Must be able to commit to at least 15-20 hours a week. Academic credit can be arranged.

Primary Reporting Responsibility: National Training Curriculum Assistant

ABT JKO School Internship

Education and Training

General Description: This position is primarily responsible for assisting the ABT JKO School Children’s Division faculty and are primarily scheduled in Pre-Primary and Primary Level classes, however, additional classes may be assigned as needed. In addition to being in the studio with faculty, ABT JKO School interns will serve as administrative liaisons between faculty, students, and staff and will provide support on special projects related to the ABT JKO School throughout the school year. The position reports to the Children’s Division Staff, with secondary reporting into the Pre-Professional Division Staff.

This position is primarily responsible for the following:

Taking attendance

Demonstrating classroom exercises

Keeping order in the classroom

Assisting in taking students to and from their classes, as well as in the transition between classes, at the JKO School

Assisting at Children’s Division performances and demonstrations, dates to be provided

Supporting the JKO School administrative staff in the management of studio space & equipment (i.e. ballet barres, pianos, A/V equipment)

Substitute teaching as necessary when full-time faculty is unavailable (at the discretion of the Children’s Division/Pre-Professional Directors and Artistic Director of the JKO School)

Creating records that track attendance and behavior and facilitating communication between artistic faculty and JKO Administrative Staff

Research projects associated with Education and Training programs

Assisting the JKO School administrative staff as needed

Interns may be nominated for a scholarship to attend an ABT National Training Curriculum Teacher Training Intensive or “Raising the Barre” Weekend Workshop to further their education and development in the classroom upon successful completion of the internship.

Position Qualifications:

Must have excellent interpersonal skills and work well with children. Ideal candidate is interested in teaching ballet and the key elements of the ABT National Training Curriculum and is currently enrolled in a Dance Education ore Pre-Professional training program in the tri-state area. Computer literacy is a must.

Applicants who are interested must be able to commit to three to five days per week for the entire academic year (September through May). Most Children’s Division classes are in the afternoon/evening hours (4:00-8:00 PM). Saturday mornings are also preferred.

Primary Reporting Responsibility: ABT JKO School Directors

Press Internship

Press

General Description: This position is primarily responsible for assisting in the Press and Public Relations Department.

Maintains media lists

Collects and distributes press clippings to staff

Assists in researching press kit materials and assembling press kits

Assists in distribution of approved photos to press

Greets media crews and members of the press for interviews, photo shoots, or filming, and assists as needed

Attends and assists at Company performances and special events

Proofreads press releases and other materials

Helps with day-to-day tasks and other Press duties as assigned

Position Qualifications:

Must have excellent writing and communication skills. Must be attentive to detail, have ability to meet strict deadlines, and be a self-starter. This position is available to students in at least their Junior-level year of Undergraduate Studies and Graduate-level students. Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint required. Experience in Photoshop and Mailchimp (or similar email platform) a plus. Knowledge of dance and performing arts preferred. May require occasional evening and weekend hours.

Hybrid work environment. In-person availability required.

Primary Reporting Responsibility: Press Coordinator

Secondary Reporting Responsibility: Director, Press and Web Development

Internship Program Application Form

Institutional Support Internship

Development

General Description: This position is primarily responsible for assisting the Institutional Support division within Development. Duties may include, but are not limited to:

Assist Institutional Support Manager with preparing foundation, corporate, and government proposals for submission

Assist with drafting reports and acknowledgment letters for funders

Assist with preparing Institutional Support mailings

Assist with donor cultivation by tracking and processing ticket requests and event RSVPs

Help organize and maintain accurate records in Raiser’s Edge

Assist with researching prospective funding opportunities

Help with day-to-day tasks such as copying and assembling materials

Support Development Department-wide activities, including special events, as needed

Other duties as assigned

Position Qualifications:

Must have excellent writing and communication skills. Must be attentive to detail, have ability to meet strict deadlines, and be a self-starter. Must be at least a sophomore in college at time of application and be available for a minimum of 15 hours per week. Computer literacy is a must, including proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel. Familiarity with Raiser’s Edge a plus. Knowledge of dance and performing arts preferred.

Hybrid work environment. In-person availability required.

Primary Reporting Responsibility: Institutional Relations Manager

Internship Program Application Form

Major Gifts / Donor Relations Internship

Development

General Description: This position is responsible for assisting the Major Gifts Team and Manager of Donor Relations in stewarding members of Golden Circle, Majors, and Board of Trustees. General duties include:

Assist Major Gifts Associate with administrative duties and projects

Conduct in-depth online research of high net-worth single-ticket buyers for cultivation and addition into ABT’s Major Donor portfolio

Assist in managing portfolio of current and prospective donors, including the organization and maintenance of accurate records for files, Raisers Edge, and Playbill

Support Major Gifts and Development Department-wide activities and special events in conjunction with ABT’s annual seasons at either the Metropolitan Opera House or David H. Koch Theatre on a select basis as needed

Assist in processing gifts and drafting acknowledgement letters

Assist in creating and processing mailings

Help with day-to-day tasks such as copying and assembling materials

Assisting with ticket orders for ABT’s Summer and Fall New York Seasons

Assist with phone calls to donors to verify and collect ticket-related information

Helps organize hundreds of patron ticket orders in Excel and patron databases

Maintains accurate information in database involving ticketing, ticket order fulfillment, patron reports

Supports the organization and physical mailing of tickets

Assists with the editing and monitoring of all ABT Playbill’s and donor crediting across multiple pieces of literature and publication

Optional assistance with Met on-site Summer season, including Summer Gala, performances, Membership table

Other duties as assigned

Position Qualifications:

Hybrid work environment. In-person availability required. College student or recent graduate (Bachelor’s degree preferred) with availability to commit to a schedule of 3-5 days per week. Additional nights and weekends outside of regular office hours may be required to assist with staffing cultivation events.

The ideal candidate has enthusiastic energy, a keen attention to detail, is highly organized and self-sufficient. Excellent verbal and written communication skills are required. Must have stellar interpersonal/customer service skills, the ability to meet strict deadlines, as well as multitask. Database experience a plus. Knowledge of and interest in ballet and the performing arts desired.

Primary Reporting Responsibility: Major Gifts Associate

Secondary Reporting Responsibility: Manager of Donor Relations

Internship Program Application Form

Membership / Special Events Internship

Development

General Description: This position is primarily responsible for assisting with all operational facets of the Membership and Special Events Departments and will participate in all department fundraising events and activities. The Membership and Special Events Intern will support both departments in the following:

Membership:

Work with Membership Assistant and Coordinator to collaborate on new ways to steward donors, generate acknowledgement letters, and update membership records accordingly.

Work with Assistant Manager of Special Events to assist with logistics of member events including studio visits, receptions, and special lectures.

Work with Database Manager to maintain integrity of database and analyze and edit data to ensure accuracy.

Work with Membership Coordinator on various ways to target specific donor groups and ensure effective workflow within the department.

Supports Membership Associate with member subscriptions and ticketing, preparing, proofing, and customizing orders, data entry, database tracking, mailings, managing and reconciling expenses, and donor confirmations.

Help clean and maintain Raisers’ Edge, our Donor Database.

Special Events:

Assist with mailings such as invitations, photos, acknowledgement letters, etc.

Format and edit mailing labels, envelopes, invitation lists, etc.

Maintain inventory of supplies (letterhead, brochures, invitations, stamps, seating charts) for Events department; responsible for ordering new materials as required

Manage distribution of departmental mail; update contact information for returned mail

Coordinate all departmental filings

Assist in designing all in-house event materials such as place cards or event signage

Draft event descriptions for ABT website and update all events web pages

Prospect research as assigned

Produce Special Events acknowledgement letters

Track RSVPs for events

Serve as contact for patron event inquiries

Staff all special events

Other duties as assigned

Position Qualifications:

This position is available to students in at least their Junior-level year of Undergraduate Studies and Graduate-level students. Proficiency in Microsoft programs including Excel, and familiarity with databases preferred but not required. This internship will provide a great opportunity to experience how a Membership and Development Department runs in a successful non-profit organization. Students seeking academic credit are encouraged to apply.

Primary Reporting Responsibility: Assistant Manager, Special Events and Membership Assistant
